title: Spring force - series and parallel arrangements

content.question: Two identical springs, each with spring constant <math alttext="k sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>k</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and negligible mass, are arranged as shown in Figure 1. A block is attached to the springs and lowered until the block-springs system reaches its equilibrium position. At equilibrium, the lower ends of the springs are displaced a distance <math alttext="delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> from where the springs were at their relaxed length. The block is removed, and the springs are rearranged as shown in Figure 2. The block is then attached to the bottom spring and lowered until the new block-springs system reaches its equilibrium position. At equilibrium, the lower end of the bottom spring is displaced a distance <math alttext="delta x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> from where the springs were at their relaxed length. What is the relationship between <math alttext="delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="delta x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta x sub 2 equals 4 delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta x sub 2 equals 2 delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta x sub 2 equals delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta x sub 2 equals one half delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn></mstyle></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta x sub 2 equals 4 delta x sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
